shortdesc.ph: Starts media stream relay across channels or updates the target channels for the relay.
Starts or updates media stream relay across channels.

section.p: The first successful call to this method relays the media stream from the source channel to the target channel. To relay to additional channels or stop relaying to a specific channel, you can call this method again to update the target channels. Up to six target channels are supported.

The first successful call to this method relays the media stream from the source channel to the destination channel. To relay to additional channels or stop relaying to a specific channel, call this method again to update the destination channels. This feature supports relaying to up to six destination channels.

ul.li: Call this method after joining a channel.
This method is only effective when you are a host in a live broadcast channel.
The media stream relay across channels feature must be enabled by contacting technical support.
This method does not support string user accounts.

section.note: Call this method after joining a channel. This method only takes effect if you are a broadcaster in a live broadcast channel. Contact technical support to enable the media stream relay feature across channels. This API does not support string user accounts.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p:
After this method is successfully called, the SDK triggers the callback to report the media stream relay status. Common statuses include:
If the callback returns RELAY_STATE_RUNNING (2) and RELAY_OK (0), it means the SDK has successfully started relaying the media stream from the source channel to the target channel.
If the callback returns RELAY_STATE_FAILURE (3), it indicates an error occurred during the media stream relay.

After successfully calling this method, the SDK triggers the callback to report the state of the media stream relay.
If the callback returns RELAY_STATE_RUNNING (2) and RELAY_OK (0), the SDK has successfully started relaying the media stream from the source channel to the destination channel.
If the callback returns RELAY_STATE_FAILURE (3), an error occurred during the media stream relay.
